Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stethoscope \Steth"o*scope\, v. t. To auscultate, or examine, with a stethoscope. --M. W. Savage. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stethoscope \Steth"o*scope\ (st[e^]th"[-o]*sk[=o]p), n. [Gr. sth^qos the breast + -scope: cf. F. st['e]thoscope.] (Med.) An instrument used in auscultation for examining the organs of the chest, as the heart and lungs, by conveying to the ear of the examiner the sounds produced in the thorax. [1913 Webster]
stethoscope n : a medical instrument for listening to the sounds generated inside the body
